verses.verse: Be not thou <S%H7065>envious<s%> against <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H582>men<s%>, neither <S%H183>desire<s%> to be with them.
For their <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H1897>studieth<s%> <S%H7701>destruction<s%>, and their <S%H8193>lips<s%> <S%H1696>talk<s%> of <S%H5999>mischief<s%>.
Through <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> is an <S%H1004>house<s%> <S%H1129>builded<s%>; and by <S%H8394>understanding<s%> it is <S%H3559>established<s%>:
And by <S%H1847>knowledge<s%> shall the <S%H2315>chambers<s%> be <S%H4390>filled<s%> with all <S%H3368>precious<s%> and <S%H5273>pleasant<s%> <S%H1952>riches<s%>.

A <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H1397>man<s%> is <S%H5797>strong<s%>; yea, a <S%H376>man<s%> of <S%H1847>knowledge<s%> <S%H553>increaseth<s%> <S%H3581>strength<s%>. is strong: Heb. is in strength increaseth: Heb. strengtheneth might
For by wise <S%H8458>counsel<s%> thou shalt <S%H6213>make<s%> thy <S%H4421>war<s%>: and in <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of <S%H3289>counsellors<s%> there is <S%H8668>safety<s%>.
<S%H2454>Wisdom<s%> is too <S%H7311>high<s%> for a <S%H191>fool<s%>: he <S%H6605>openeth<s%> not his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> in the <S%H8179>gate<s%>.
He that <S%H2803>deviseth<s%> to do <S%H7489>evil<s%> shall be <S%H7121>called<s%> a <S%H4209>mischievous<s%> <S%H1167>person<s%>.
The <S%H2154>thought<s%> of <S%H200>foolishness<s%> is <S%H2403>sin<s%>: and the <S%H3887>scorner<s%> is an <S%H8441>abomination<s%> to <S%H120>men<s%>.
If thou <S%H7503>faint<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of <S%H6869>adversity<s%>, thy <S%H3581>strength<s%> is <S%H6862>small<s%>. small: Heb. narrow
If thou <S%H2820>forbear<s%> to <S%H5337>deliver<s%> them that are <S%H3947>drawn<s%> unto <S%H4194>death<s%>, and those that are <S%H4131>ready<s%> to be <S%H2027>slain<s%>;

If thou <S%H559>sayest<s%>, Behold, we <S%H3045>knew<s%> it not; doth not he that <S%H8505>pondereth<s%> the <S%H3826>heart<s%> <S%H995>consider<s%> it? and he that <S%H5341>keepeth<s%> thy <S%H5315>soul<s%>, doth not he <S%H3045>know<s%> it? and shall not he <S%H7725>render<s%> to every <S%H120>man<s%> according to his <S%H6467>works<s%>?

My <S%H1121>son<s%>, <S%H398>eat<s%> thou <S%H1706>honey<s%>, because it is <S%H2896>good<s%>; and the <S%H5317>honeycomb<s%>, which is <S%H4966>sweet<s%> to thy <S%H2441>taste<s%>: to: Heb. upon thy palate

So shall the <S%H3045>knowledge<s%> of <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> be unto thy <S%H5315>soul<s%>: when thou hast <S%H4672>found<s%> it, then there shall <S%H3426>be<s%> a <S%H319>reward<s%>, and thy <S%H8615>expectation<s%> shall not be cut <S%H3772>off<s%>.
Lay not <S%H693>wait<s%>, O <S%H7563>wicked<s%> man, against the <S%H5116>dwelling<s%> of the <S%H6662>righteous<s%>; <S%H7703>spoil<s%> not his resting <S%H7258>place<s%>:
For a <S%H6662>just<s%> man <S%H5307>falleth<s%> seven <S%H7651>times<s%>, and riseth up <S%H6965>again<s%>: but the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> shall <S%H3782>fall<s%> into <S%H7451>mischief<s%>.
<S%H8055>Rejoice<s%> not when thine <S%H341>enemy<s%> <S%H5307>falleth<s%>, and let not thine <S%H3820>heart<s%> be <S%H1523>glad<s%> when he <S%H3782>stumbleth<s%>:

Lest the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H7200>see<s%> it, and it <S%H7489>displease<s%> <S%H5869><s%> him, and he turn <S%H7725>away<s%> his <S%H639>wrath<s%> from him. it displeaseth: Heb. it be evil in his eyes
<S%H2734>Fret<s%> not thyself because of <S%H7489>evil<s%> men, neither be thou <S%H7065>envious<s%> at the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>; Fret: or, Keep not company with the wicked
For there shall be no <S%H319>reward<s%> to the <S%H7451>evil<s%> man; the <S%H5216>candle<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> shall be put <S%H1846>out<s%>. candle: or, lamp
My <S%H1121>son<s%>, <S%H3372>fear<s%> thou the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> and the <S%H4428>king<s%>: and <S%H6148>meddle<s%> not with them that are given to <S%H8138>change<s%>: them: Heb. changers
For their <S%H343>calamity<s%> shall <S%H6965>rise<s%> <S%H6597>suddenly<s%>; and who <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> the <S%H6365>ruin<s%> of them <S%H8147>both<s%>?
These things also belong to the <S%H2450>wise<s%>. It is not <S%H2896>good<s%> to have <S%H5234>respect<s%> of <S%H6440>persons<s%> in <S%H4941>judgment<s%>.
He that <S%H559>saith<s%> unto the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>, Thou art <S%H6662>righteous<s%>; him shall the <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H5344>curse<s%>, <S%H3816>nations<s%> shall <S%H2194>abhor<s%> him:
But to them that <S%H3198>rebuke<s%> him shall be <S%H5276>delight<s%>, and a <S%H2896>good<s%> <S%H1293>blessing<s%> shall <S%H935>come<s%> upon them. a good: Heb. a blessing of good
Every man shall <S%H5401>kiss<s%> his <S%H8193>lips<s%> that <S%H7725>giveth<s%> a <S%H5228>right<s%> <S%H1697>answer<s%>. that: Heb. that answereth right words

<S%H3559>Prepare<s%> thy <S%H4399>work<s%> <S%H2351>without<s%>, and make it <S%H6257>fit<s%> for thyself in the <S%H7704>field<s%>; and <S%H310>afterwards<s%> <S%H1129>build<s%> thine <S%H1004>house<s%>.
Be not a <S%H5707>witness<s%> against thy <S%H7453>neighbour<s%> without <S%H2600>cause<s%>; and <S%H6601>deceive<s%> not with thy <S%H8193>lips<s%>.
<S%H559>Say<s%> not, I will <S%H6213>do<s%> so to him as he hath <S%H6213>done<s%> to me: I will <S%H7725>render<s%> to the <S%H376>man<s%> according to his <S%H6467>work<s%>.
I <S%H5674>went<s%> by the <S%H7704>field<s%> of the <S%H376>slothful<s%> <S%H6102><s%>, and by the <S%H3754>vineyard<s%> of the <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H2638>void<s%> of <S%H3820>understanding<s%>;

And, lo, it was all grown <S%H5927>over<s%> with <S%H7063>thorns<s%>, and <S%H2738>nettles<s%> had <S%H3680>covered<s%> the <S%H6440>face<s%> thereof, and the <S%H68>stone<s%> <S%H1444>wall<s%> thereof was broken <S%H2040>down<s%>.
Then I <S%H2372>saw<s%>, and considered it <S%H7896>well<s%> <S%H3820><s%>: I <S%H7200>looked<s%> upon it, and <S%H3947>received<s%> <S%H4148>instruction<s%>. considered: Heb. set my heart
Yet a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H8142>sleep<s%>, a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H8572>slumber<s%>, a <S%H4592>little<s%> <S%H2264>folding<s%> of the <S%H3027>hands<s%> to <S%H7901>sleep<s%>:
So shall thy <S%H7389>poverty<s%> <S%H935>come<s%> as one that <S%H1980>travelleth<s%>; and thy <S%H4270>want<s%> as an <S%H4043>armed<s%> <S%H376>man<s%>. an: Heb. a man of shield
